name: Jesús Martín
mainDescription: I'm a full-stack Software Engineer based in Spain.
about: I'm a graduated Software Engineer with over four years of experience. I'm passionate about Full-Stack Development, DevOps, and Cloud Infrastructure. Based in Málaga, Spain, I thrive on creating and maintaining dynamic applications. I love exploring new technologies and am committed to delivering high-quality code. On the backend, I specialize in Node.js with Express.js for event-driven applications and have extensive experience with RabbitMQ for event-driven architectures to boost performance. On the frontend, I focus on React for dynamic UIs and Next.js for server-side rendering and static sites. I’ve also worked with Angular and prefer Tailwind CSS for fast, responsive designs. In DevOps, I can work on tasks such as automating and preparing deployments. I deploy with Kubernetes, manage infrastructure with Terraform, and set up CI/CD processes. I deploy frontend apps with Vercel and manage cloud resources with AWS.

projects.title: Portfolio
projects.subtitle: Personal portfolio website
projects.description: This is my personal portfolio website, built with the Astro framework. It showcases my work, skills, and experience. The site is fully responsive, optimized for performance, and deployed on Vercel.

projects.title: NBA Go
projects.subtitle: NBA Livescoreboard mobile app
projects.description: NBA Go is a fan-made mobile app for real-time NBA scores, game schedules, player stats, and conference standings. It includes a player search feature with filters and career stats. Built with Flutter, it uses the BLoC pattern for state management, the NBA API for data, and SQLite to cache player data.

projects.title: Vid.io
projects.subtitle: App for screen capture and clip sharing.
projects.description: VID.io is a webapp that enables users to capture and share screen recordings. It allows users to record their screen, store clips, and share them easily with others. The app is built with Shadcn components for a modern user interface, and uses Auth0 for secure user authentication. Video clips are stored in Amazon S3, and the app uses FFmpeg for transcoding, ensuring that clips are in a shareable format.
